name: Protected Areas
description: Legally designated conservation areas including national parks, nature reserves, and other protected land and marine areas.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.I.9: Feature type: ProtectedSite. Required: unique_id, geometry (point, line, or polygon), siteDesignation (DesignationType), siteProtectionClassification (ProtectionClassificationValue: natureConservation, ecological, landscape, environment, geological). Designation schemes include: Natura2000, Ramsar, UNESCOWorldHeritage, IUCN, nationalProtectedSite.

name: Administrative Boundaries
description: Official jurisdictional boundaries for municipal, district, and sub-district administrative units used for governance and statistical reporting.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.I.4: Required attributes: unique_id, geometry (polygon/multipolygon), nationalCode (text), nationalLevel (AdministrativeHierarchyLevel), country (CountryCode), name (GeographicalName). Recommended: beginLifespanVersion, endLifespanVersion, residenceOfAuthority. Code list: AdministrativeHierarchyLevel (1stOrder through 6thOrder).
example_dataset: GADM Database of Global Administrative Areas

name: Master Plan
description: Official urban development plans including zoning designations, planned infrastructure, growth boundaries, and development policies.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.4: Feature types: SpatialPlan, ZoningElement, SupplementaryRegulation. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon), hilucsLandUse (HILUCSValue), levelOfSpatialPlan (LevelOfSpatialPlanValue: national, regional, local), validFrom, validTo. Plan types include: masterPlan, comprehensivePlan, detailedPlan, localPlan.

name: Zoning
description: Legal land use zones defining permitted activities, development densities, and building regulations by designated area.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.4: Feature type: ZoningElement. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon), hilucsLandUse (HILUCSValue), regulationNature (RegulationNatureValue: bindingForDevelopers, bindingOnlyForAuthorities, notBinding). Recommended: specificLandUse (national classification), dimensioningIndication, backgroundMap.

name: Cultural Sites
description: Locations of cultural heritage assets including historic buildings, monuments, archaeological sites, and protected cultural landscapes.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.I.9: Feature type: ProtectedSite. Required: unique_id, geometry (point, line, or polygon), siteDesignation (DesignationType with designationScheme and designation), siteProtectionClassification (ProtectionClassificationValue: cultural, archaeological). Recommended: siteName, legalFoundationDate, legalFoundationDocument. Designation schemes include: UNESCOWorldHeritage, NationalMonumentsRecord, or national cultural heritage registers.
comments: Extension to the RDLS Exposure component to include cultural heritage

name: Building Characteristics
description: Building inventory data including footprints, heights, structural characteristics, construction date, occupancy type, and replacement values for exposure and vulnerability assessment.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.2: Feature type: Building. Required: inspireId, geometry (polygon footprint or point), conditionOfConstruction (ConditionOfConstructionValue: functional, projected, underConstruction, notUsable, demolished). Recommended: currentUse (CurrentUseValue), dateOfConstruction, heightAboveGround or numberOfFloorsAboveGround, buildingNature. For RDLS Exposure: add taxonomy (GEM Building Taxonomy v3.0: material, lateral_system, height_class, occupancy), cost_value, cost_unit. See RDLS 0.2 Exposure schema for valuation attributes.

name: Informal Settlements
description: Locations and extent of informal or unplanned settlements including slums, squatter areas, and areas with insecure tenure.
requirements: No direct INSPIRE theme; use D2.8.II.2 Land Cover or D2.8.III.4 Land Use for settlement extent. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon), settlementName or identifier. Recommended: estimatedPopulation, estimatedHouseholds, dateOfObservation, dataSource (satellite-derived, community-mapped, government survey). See Atlas of Informality for example dataset.
comments: This assumes we are interested in the boundaries of informal settlement areas rather than building-level classification.

name: Building Inspections
description: Records of structural safety inspections including dates, compliance status, and identified deficiencies for buildings.
requirements: No direct INSPIRE theme (regulatory/administrative records). Building being inspected may reference INSPIRE D2.8.III.2 Buildings. Required: unique_id, buildingReference (link to inspected building), inspectionDate. Recommended: complianceStatus, deficienciesIdentified, inspectorId, nextInspectionDue. Note: time-series data with multiple inspections per building.

name: Building Registry
description: Official cadastral or municipal records of building characteristics, legal status, property valuation, and land parcel information.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.2: Application schema: BuildingsExtended2D. Feature type: Building. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon). Recommended: externalReference (link to cadastral/property register), officialArea, officialValue (with currency), currentUse (CurrentUseValue), numberOfDwellings. Link to CadastralParcel via D2.8.I.6.

name: Housing Development
description: Locations and characteristics of new residential construction including permits, units under development, and planned housing projects.
requirements: No single INSPIRE theme. For buildings under construction use D2.8.III.2 Buildings (conditionOfConstruction: underConstruction). For planned development sites use D2.8.III.4 Land Use - Planned Land Use. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon). Recommended: permitDate, permitStatus, numberOfDwellings (planned), constructionPhase, estimatedCompletionDate.
comments: Alternatively, we could update the RDLS Exposure module to handle future exposure

name: Elevation
description: Digital elevation model (DEM) representing terrain height above a vertical datum, used for flood modeling, slope analysis, aspect derivation, and drainage delineation.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.II.1: Feature type: ElevationGridCoverage (raster) or ElevationVectorElements (contours/points). Required: unique_id, domainExtent, surfaceType (DTM, DSM), verticalCRS. Recommended: spatialResolution, verticalAccuracy, interpolationType.

name: Electricity Infrastructure
inspire_spec: D2.8.III.6 Utility and Governmental Services v3.0
description: Electricity transmission and distribution infrastructure including substations, transmission lines, and distribution networks.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.6 (UtilityNetwork) + D2.8.III.8 (ProductionFacility). Required: unique_id, geometry (point for facilities, line for networks), facilityType (generation, transmission, substation, distribution). For generation: generationType (thermal, hydro, solar, wind, nuclear), capacity_MW, fuelType. For networks: voltageLevel_kV, lineLength. Recommended: operationalStatus, yearBuilt, ownership.

name: Electricity Capacity
inspire_spec: D2.8.III.6 Utility and Governmental Services v3.0
description: Diversity and capacity of electricity supply sources serving the city, measuring energy system redundancy and resilience.
requirements: No direct INSPIRE theme (aggregated indicator data). Use D2.8.III.1 Statistical Units for geographic aggregation. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon - city or service area). Recommended: installedCapacity_MW, generationMix (percent by source type), peakDemand_MW, reserveMargin, numberOfSupplySources, redundancyIndex

name: Climate Emissions
description: Greenhouse gas and air pollutant emission inventories by source sector, quantifying releases from energy, transport, industry, waste, and land use activities.
requirements: No direct INSPIRE theme (inventory/reporting data, not spatial observations). Use D2.8.III.1 Statistical Units for geographic aggregation. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon - city or sector boundary), emissionType (CO2, CH4, N2O, PM2.5), quantity (tonnes/year), sourceSector (GPC/IPCC: stationary energy, transportation, waste, IPPU, AFOLU), reportingYear, methodology (GPC, IPCC 2006). Recommended: scope (1/2/3), uncertaintyRange, dataSource.

name: Climate Models
description: Downscaled climate projection data from global or regional climate models providing future temperature, precipitation, and extreme event scenarios.
requirements: No direct INSPIRE theme. Primary standards: CF Conventions, CMIP6/CORDEX protocols. Format: NetCDF GridCoverage or COG. Required: unique_id, domainExtent (spatial bbox + temporal range), variable (tas, pr, tasmax, tasmin), scenario (SSP1-2.6, SSP2-4.5, SSP3-7.0, SSP5-8.5), projectionPeriod (e.g., 2041-2060, 2081-2100). Recommended: modelName, ensembleMember, baselinePeriod (e.g., 1981-2010), downscalingMethod (statistical/dynamical), spatialResolution, biasCorrection, uncertainty/confidence.

name: Hazard Characteristics
description: Spatial datasets describing natural hazard phenomena including extent, intensity, frequency, and probability, used as inputs to risk assessment.
requirements:
INSPIRE D2.8.III.12 Natural Risk Zones - HazardArea feature type for hazard-prone zones. Required: inspireId, geometry, typeOfHazard (NaturalHazardCategoryValue: earthquake, flood, landslide, storm, volcanicActivity, wildfire, etc.), likelihoodOfOccurrence, magnitudeOrIntensity.
RDLS 0.2 Hazard schema for dataset metadata. Required: hazard_type, process_type, intensity_measure (with units). Recommended: analysis_type (deterministic/probabilistic), calculation_method (inferred/simulated/observed), occurrence_range or occurrence_probability, event_count.
Intensity measures vary by hazard: flood depth (m) / velocity (m/s), ground shaking PGA (g) / PGV (cm/s), wind speed (m/s), ash thickness (cm), fire intensity (kW/m), drought index (SPI/SPEI).

name: Urban Heat Island
description: Spatial analysis of localized temperature amplification in urban areas relative to surrounding rural areas, including surface temperature differentials, contributing factors (impervious surfaces, vegetation deficit, building density), and temporal patterns.
requirements: No direct INSPIRE theme (derived urban climate analysis). Related themes: D2.8.II.2 Land Cover (surface characteristics), D2.8.III.2 Buildings (urban form). Required: unique_id, geometry (raster grid or polygon zones), surfaceTemperature (Â°C or K), temperatureAnomaly (difference from rural baseline), dateOfObservation. Recommended: landSurfaceType (impervious/vegetation/water/bare), vegetationIndex (NDVI), imperviousFraction, buildingDensity, skyViewFactor, seasonality (summer/winter/annual), timeOfDay (daytime/nighttime), dataSource (satellite thermal/ground stations/modeled)

name: Disaster Record
description: Historical catalog of disaster events across all hazard types including dates, locations, intensity observations, affected areas, and documented impacts.
requirements: No single INSPIRE theme (event catalog data). For observed footprints: D2.8.III.12 HazardArea with determinationMethod: observed. Required: unique_id, eventName, eventDate, hazardType, location (point or polygon). Recommended: magnitude/intensity, affectedArea_km2, dataSource, observedFootprint (geometry), impactSummary. For seismic events: magnitude, depth_km, focalMechanism. For hydrometeorological: duration, peakIntensity.

name: Disaster Impacts
description: Historical records of disaster consequences including casualties, economic losses, displaced populations, and infrastructure damage by event.
requirements: RDLS schema defines requirements. Loss component: observed. Key attributes: event_id, hazard_type, loss_type, value. See RDLS 0.2 Loss schema.

name: Disaster Risk
description: Modeled risk outputs combining hazard, exposure, and vulnerability to estimate expected losses or damage probabilities.
requirements: RDLS schema defines requirements. No direct INSPIRE equivalent - risk model outputs. Key attributes per RDLS 0.2 Loss schema: hazard_type, exposure_type, risk_metric (AAL, PML, return_period_loss), spatial_unit, calculation_date, model_source, uncertainty_bounds. Include: exceedance probability curves, contributing hazard scenarios.

name: Damage Functions
description: Mathematical relationships describing expected damage or loss ratio as a function of hazard intensity for specific asset types.
requirements: RDLS schema defines requirements. No direct INSPIRE equivalent - vulnerability/fragility functions. Key attributes per RDLS 0.2 Vulnerability schema: taxonomy (building type), hazard_type, intensity_measure, function_type (fragility, vulnerability, damage-to-loss), damage_states or loss_ratio, uncertainty parameters. Reference: GEM Vulnerability Guidelines.

name: Faults
description: Mapped geological fault lines including fault type, slip rate, maximum magnitude potential, and recurrence intervals for seismic hazard assessment.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.II.4 Geology - ShearDisplacementStructure (via MappedFeature). Required: unique_id, geometry (line or polygon), faultType (FaultTypeValue: normalFault, reverseFault, thrustFault, strikeslipFault, obliqueSlipFault, detachmentFault). Recommended: geologicHistory (age range), activityStatus (active/inactive/uncertain), slipRate_mm_yr, maxMagnitudePotential, recurrenceInterval_yr, lastRuptureDate, segmentLength_km, dip, rake.

name: Sea-Level Rise
description: Projected sea level rise scenarios and coastal inundation zones under different climate and timeframe assumptions.
requirements: No direct INSPIRE theme (climate projection data). D2.8.III.12 HazardArea is a workaround (typeOfHazard: flood, determinationMethod: modelling). Required: unique_id, geometry (raster or polygon inundation zones), projectedSLR_m, scenario (RCP2.6/4.5/8.5 or SSP1-2.6/2-4.5/5-8.5), projectionYear, baselineYear, verticalDatum (e.g., MSL, NAVD88). Recommended: confidenceInterval, iceSheetContribution, thermalExpansionContribution, subsidence_mm_yr, dataSource.
example_dataset: Climate Central Coastal Risk Screening Tool

name: Disease Prevalence
inspire_spec: D2.8.III.5 Human Health and Safety v3.0
description: Epidemiological data on disease incidence and prevalence rates, including climate-sensitive diseases and baseline health conditions that affect population vulnerability to disasters.
requirements:
INSPIRE D2.8.III.5 Human Health and Safety - Disease feature type. Required: unique_id, geometry (point or polygon) or statisticalUnit reference, pathology (ICD-10 code or PathologyValue), diseaseMeasure (incidence/prevalence/mortality rate), value, referencePeriod. Recommended: ageGroup, gender, populationAtRisk, dataSource, confidenceInterval. For climate-sensitive diseases: vectorSpecies, transmissionSeason, climateSuitability.

ISO 37123 indicator 11.4: Number of infectious disease outbreaks (locally declared).
example_dataset: WHO Global Health Observatory: Hepatitis - prevalence of chronic hepatitis among the general population
comments: Not sure if this is critical

name: Agricultural Exposure
inspire_spec: D2.8.III.9 Agricultural and Aquaculture Facilities v3.0
description: Location and extent of agricultural assets including cropland, livestock facilities, and aquaculture operations exposed to natural hazards.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.9: Feature type: Holding or Site. Required: unique_id, geometry (point, line, or polygon). Recommended: activity (NACE Rev.2 Division 01-03), status (ConditionOfFacilityValue: functional, disused, projected, underConstruction), validFrom, validTo. Include: facility type, production capacity, crop/livestock type, area cultivated.

name: Urban Tree Canopy
description: Spatial extent, density, and vertical structure of tree canopy in urban areas, used for urban heat island mitigation assessment, stormwater management, and green infrastructure planning.
requirements: NSPIRE D2.8.II.2 Land Cover for canopy extent; D2.8.II.1 Elevation for canopy height models (DSM minus DTM). Required: unique_id, geometry (raster or polygon). For coverage: canopyCover_percent or canopyArea_m2. For height: canopyHeight_m (mean/max). Recommended: treeCount, speciesDominance, healthStatus, changeDetection (gain/loss), dateOfObservation, dataSource (LiDAR/satellite/aerial).

name: Green Area
description: Extent and distribution of urban green spaces including parks, gardens, street trees, and other vegetated areas.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.II.2: Feature type: LandCoverUnit. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon), landCoverObservation with class (LandCoverClassValue). CORINE classes: 141 (Green urban areas), 311-313 (Forests), 321-324 (Scrub and herbaceous vegetation). Recommended: observationDate.
comments: Possible overlap with other data types including parks, open space, tree canopy, and NDVI.

name: Impervious Surfaces
description: Land cover classification identifying paved and sealed surfaces that prevent water infiltration, used for runoff modeling.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.II.2: Feature type: LandCoverUnit or LandCoverGridCoverage. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon or raster), landCoverObservation with class. For imperviousness degree use continuous value 0-100%. Recommended: observationDate. Copernicus High Resolution Layer for Europe provides 10m resolution.

name: Landcover Change
description: Multi-temporal analysis of land cover transitions showing conversion between land cover classes over defined time periods.
requirements: Requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.II.2 Land Cover - LandCoverUnit with multiple observations. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon), multiple landCoverObservation records with different observationDate values. For change layers, each LandCoverUnit shall have at least two LandCoverObservation values with different observation dates. Recommended: previousLandCover, currentLandCover, changeDate, changeType (conversion/modification).

name: Landcover/Landuse
inspire_spec: D2.8.II.2 Land Cover v3.0 + D2.8.III.4 Land Use v3.1.1
description: Classification of land surface by physical cover type (including built-up, bare ground, wetlands, vegetation, water) and functional use, following standard taxonomies such as CORINE, ESA WorldCover, or national classification systems.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.II.2 + D2.8.III.4: Feature types: LandCoverUnit + ExistingLandUseObject. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon), landCoverObservation with class (LandCoverClassValue). For combined datasets include hilucsLandUse. The observation date shall be defined either in the LandCoverDataset or in each LandCoverObservation.
comments: Could be separated into two distinct data types if desired

name: NDVI
description: Normalized Difference Vegetation Index derived from satellite imagery indicating vegetation health and density.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.II.2: Feature type: LandCoverGridCoverage (derived index). Required: unique_id, domainExtent, rangeSet (continuous values -1 to +1). Include: observationDate, sensor/platform, spatial resolution. Nomenclature documentation shall reference the index methodology used.

name: NDWI
description: Normalized Difference Water Index derived from satellite imagery for identifying water bodies and moisture content.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.II.2: Feature type: LandCoverGridCoverage (derived index). Required: unique_id, domainExtent, rangeSet (continuous values -1 to +1). Include: observationDate, sensor/platform, spatial resolution, band combination used (Green-NIR or NIR-SWIR methodology).
example_dataset: USGS EROS Archive - Vegetation Monitoring - eVIIRS Global NDWI

name: Parks
description: Locations and extent of public parks, open spaces, recreational areas, and urban green spaces with facility and accessibility attributes.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.4: Feature type: ExistingLandUseObject. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon), hilucsLandUse = 6_4 (Sports, leisure and recreation) or subcategories. Recommended: specificLandUse, observationDate. Include: park type, public access status, area, facilities.
comments: Could overlap with Protected Areas or several other data types.

name: Urban Extent
description: Spatial boundary or footprint of urbanized area, distinguishing built-up areas from rural or undeveloped land.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.II.2: Feature type: LandCoverUnit. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon), landCoverObservation with class (artificial surfaces). CORINE Level 1 Class 1 (Artificial surfaces) or Urban Atlas urban fabric classes. Recommended: observationDate, validFrom, validTo for temporal versioning.

name: Nighttime vs Daytime Population
description: Temporal variation in population distribution between residential nighttime locations and workplace or activity daytime locations.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.10: Feature type: StatisticalDistribution. Required: statisticalUnit reference, value (StatisticalValue), periodOfMeasurement. Dimension: day/night indicator.
comments: LandScan Global Population data only has daytime/nighttime information for the United States

name: Population
description: Population counts and demographic structure by administrative unit or grid cell, including total population, age distribution, sex ratio, and household composition.
requirements: RDLS schema defines requirements. INSPIRE D2.8.III.10: Feature type: StatisticalDistribution. Required: statisticalUnit reference, value (StatisticalValue), periodOfMeasurement. Dimensions: age group, sex, household size. Exposure type: population. See RDLS 0.2 Exposure schema.

name: Population Growth
description: Rate of population change over time including natural increase and net migration components.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.10: Feature type: StatisticalDistribution. Required: statisticalUnit reference, value (StatisticalValue), periodOfMeasurement (minimum two periods for change calculation). Recommended: growthRate_percent (annual or intercensal), naturalIncrease (births minus deaths), netMigration (in-migration minus out-migration), projectionMethod (for forecasts).

name: Vulnerable Populations
description: Population segments with elevated vulnerability to disasters including elderly, disabled, low-income, homeless, and other at-risk groups.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.10 + ISO 37123:2019 indicator 13.1. Required: statisticalUnit reference, value (StatisticalValue), periodOfMeasurement. Dimensions: age groups (0-14, 65+), disability status. ISO 37123 13.1: Vulnerable population shall be calculated as the sum of persons with physical or mental impairments, pregnant women, sick and undernourished persons, homeless persons, slum dwellers and refugees/IDPs divided by total city population multiplied by 100.

name: Liquefaction
description: Susceptibility maps for earthquake-induced soil liquefaction based on soil type, groundwater depth, and expected ground shaking intensity.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.12: Feature type: HazardArea. RDLS hazard_type: earthquake, process_type: liquefaction. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon), hazardType (NaturalHazardCategoryValue: geological). Intensity measure: liquefaction_susceptibility (categorical: very low, low, moderate, high, very high) or liquefaction_probability. Recommended: triggering_pga (g), groundwater_depth, soil_type.

name: Soil Characteristics
description: Soil characteristics including texture, composition, depth, and engineering properties relevant to construction and hazard assessment.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.3: Feature type: SoilBody. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon). A SoilBody is a part of the soil cover that is delineated and that is homogeneous with regard to certain soil properties. Recommended: soilBodyLabel, WRBSoilName (WRBSoilNameValue from FAO World Reference Base). Profile elements: depthRange, particleSizeFraction, organicCarbonContent.

name: Soil Erosion
description: Rates and patterns of soil loss from water or wind erosion, and broader land degradation indicators including fertility loss and desertification risk.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.3: Feature type: SoilDerivedObject. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon). Parameter: soilDerivedObjectParameterNameValue = soilErosionByWater or soilErosionByWind. Soil derived objects contain soil-related information derived or estimated from soil and other data. Include: erosion rate, methodology (RUSLE, PESERA), land degradation class.

name: Soil Salinity
description: Salt concentration in soils affecting agricultural productivity and land suitability, particularly in irrigated and coastal areas.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.3: Feature type: SoilDerivedObject. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon). Parameter: soilDerivedObjectParameterNameValue = salinisation. Include: electrical conductivity (dS/m), sodium adsorption ratio (optional), depth of measurement, observation date.
comments: Not sure if this is necessary.

name: Means of Transportation
inspire_spec: D2.8.III.1 Statistical Units v3.0 + D2.8.I.7 Transport Networks v3.2
description: Modal split data showing the distribution of trips by transport mode including private vehicles, public transit, walking, and cycling.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.1 + D2.8.I.7: Statistical/survey data on modal split by geographic unit. Required: statisticalUnit reference, periodOfMeasurement. Dimensions: transport mode (TransportTypeValue: road, rail, water, air, walking, cycling), trip purpose (commute, leisure, freight). Include: survey methodology, sample size, temporal coverage, origin-destination if available.

name: City Revenues
description: Municipal government revenue data including tax receipts, intergovernmental transfers, and own-source revenues for fiscal capacity assessment.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.1: Feature type: VectorStatisticalUnit. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon), country (CountryCode), code (text). Each statistical unit shall have a unique code within the statistical unit set. Statistical values via StatisticalDistribution with value, periodOfMeasurement. Include currency (ISO 4217).

name: Employment
description: Labor force statistics including employment rates, sectoral distribution, and concentration in major economic sectors.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.1: Feature type: VectorStatisticalUnit. Required: unique_id, geometry or statisticalUnit reference, code. Employment as StatisticalDistribution with periodOfMeasurement. Dimensions: employment status, economic sector (NACE classification). ISO 37123 related indicator for sector concentration.

name: GDP
description: Gross domestic product estimates at city or sub-city level, used as a proxy for economic exposure and recovery capacity.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.1: Feature type: VectorStatisticalUnit or StatisticalGridCell. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon or grid), code. GDP as StatisticalDistribution with value, periodOfMeasurement, currency (ISO 4217). Grid cells shall use standard sizes: 100m, 1km, 10km, 100km.

name: Insurance Coverage
description: Percentage of properties with insurance coverage for natural hazards, indicating financial protection and risk transfer capacity.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.1 + ISO 37123:2019 indicator 5.3. Required: statisticalUnit reference, periodOfMeasurement. ISO 37123 5.3: Percentage of properties with insurance coverage for high-risk hazards shall be calculated as the total number of properties with insurance coverage for high-risk hazards divided by the total number of properties in the city multiplied by 100.

name: Nighttime Lights
description: Satellite-derived nighttime light intensity used as a proxy for economic activity, urbanization, and electrification rates.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.1: Statistical proxy via grid coverage. Required: unique_id, raster coverage with radiance values. Include: sensor (DMSP-OLS, VIIRS), observationDate, temporal composite period, spatial resolution. For statistical use: aggregate to statistical units with mean/sum radiance.

name: Income
description: Household or individual income levels by geographic unit, used to assess economic vulnerability and recovery capacity.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.1: Feature type: VectorStatisticalUnit. Required: unique_id, geometry or statisticalUnit reference, code. Income as StatisticalDistribution with value, periodOfMeasurement, currency (ISO 4217). Include: income type (household, per capita), measurement methodology (survey, administrative), income brackets or continuous values.
example_dataset: World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform

name: Poverty
description: Poverty rates and indices measuring the proportion of population below defined poverty thresholds or experiencing material deprivation.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.1: Feature type: VectorStatisticalUnit. Required: unique_id, geometry or statisticalUnit reference. Poverty rate as StatisticalDistribution with value (percentage), periodOfMeasurement. Include: poverty line definition, measurement methodology (income-based or multidimensional).

name: Socio-economic Index
description: Composite indices measuring socioeconomic conditions including wealth, development, or deprivation across multiple indicators.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.1: Feature type: VectorStatisticalUnit. Required: unique_id, statisticalUnit reference. Composite index as StatisticalDistribution with value, periodOfMeasurement. Include: index methodology, component indicators, normalization approach.

name: Sustainability Index
description: Composite measures of urban sustainability performance across environmental, social, and economic dimensions.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.1: Feature type: VectorStatisticalUnit. Required: unique_id, statisticalUnit reference. Composite index as StatisticalDistribution with value, periodOfMeasurement. Include: index framework (SDG, ISO 37120), component indicators, weighting methodology.

name: Road Network
description: Transportation network of roads and streets including geometry, road classification, surface type, paving condition, lane count, and capacity attributes.
requirements: RDLS schema defines requirements. INSPIRE D2.8.I.7: Feature type: RoadLink. Required: unique_id, geometry (line), functionalRoadClass (FunctionalRoadClassValue). Recommended: formOfWay, numberOfLanes, surfaceCategory (paved/unpaved), condition. Include: pavement type, maintenance date, traffic volume. See RDLS 0.2 Exposure schema.

name: Shipping Infrastructure
description: Port and harbor facilities including berths, terminals, cargo handling capacity, and navigational infrastructure.
requirements: RDLS schema defines requirements. INSPIRE D2.8.I.7: Feature type: WaterwayNode (port). Required: unique_id, geometry (point or polygon). Recommended: formOfWaterwayNode. Include: port_type, capacity, berths, draft depth. See RDLS 0.2 Exposure schema.

name: Trail Network
description: Pedestrian and cycling path networks including greenways, hiking trails, and non-motorized transportation routes.
requirements: RDLS schema defines requirements. INSPIRE D2.8.I.7: Feature type: RoadLink with formOfWay = walkway or cycleway. Required: unique_id, geometry (line). Include: trail_type, surface, width, accessibility. See RDLS 0.2 Exposure schema.

name: Public Transportation Network
description: Public transit network including routes, stops, stations, and terminals for bus, rail, metro, tram, and ferry services with ridership and service frequency attributes.
requirements: RDLS schema defines requirements. INSPIRE D2.8.I.7: Feature types: RailwayLink, RoadLink (bus routes), WaterwayLink (ferry). Point features: RailwayStationNode, RoadNode (stops). Required: unique_id, geometry. Recommended: transportType (TransportTypeValue), formOfRailwayNode. Include: route_id, mode, ridership, service_frequency, accessibility. See RDLS 0.2 Exposure schema.

name: Educational Facilities
inspire_spec: D2.8.III.6 Utility and Governmental Services v3.0
description: Locations and attributes of schools, universities, and training institutions including capacity, building characteristics, and student enrollment.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.6: Feature type: GovernmentalService. Required: unique_id, geometry (point), serviceType (ServiceTypeValue: educationServices). The service type shall take values from the COFOG-based classification. Recommended: areaOfResponsibility. Include: facility type (primary, secondary, tertiary), student capacity.

name: Health Infrastructure
inspire_spec: D2.8.III.6 Utility and Governmental Services v3.0
description: Locations and capacity of healthcare facilities including hospitals, clinics, and emergency medical services with bed counts and service levels.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.6 + ISO 37123:2019 indicator 11.1. Feature type: GovernmentalService. Required: unique_id, geometry (point), serviceType = healthServices. ISO 37123 11.1: Hospitals with autonomous electricity generation divided by total hospitals multiplied by 100. Include: facility type, bed count, backup power (yes/no, duration).

name: Critical Infrastructure
inspire_spec: D2.8.III.6 Utility and Governmental Services v3.0
description: General inventory of essential facilities and systems across multiple sectors, used when sector-specific detail is not required or available. For detailed sector-specific attributes, see dedicated data types (Dams, Electricity Infrastructure, Transport Networks, Health Infrastructure.).
requirements: Multiple INSPIRE themes by sector: D2.8.III.6 (Utility and Governmental Services), D2.8.I.7 (Transport Networks), D2.8.III.8 (Production Facilities). Required: unique_id, geometry (point or polygon), sector (energy, transport, water, health, communications, emergency, waste). Recommended: facilityName, facilityType, operationalStatus, ownership.

name: Pollution
description: Measurements of atmospheric pollutant concentrations including particulate matter (PM2.5, PM10), ozone, nitrogen dioxide, and sulfur dioxide at monitoring stations.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.13: ISO 19156 O&M pattern. Required: phenomenonTime, resultTime, procedure, observedProperty (PM2.5, PM10, NO2, O3, SO2, CO per EU Directive 2008/50/EC), featureOfInterest, result. Air quality reporting shall follow EU Air Quality Directive parameters. ISO 37120 thresholds: PM2.5 annual mean < 10 Âµg/mÂ³, PM10 < 20 Âµg/mÂ³ (WHO guidelines).

name: Water Quality
description: Measurements of water quality parameters in surface water and groundwater including chemical, physical, and biological indicators.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.7: Feature type: EnvironmentalMonitoringFacility. Required: unique_id, geometry (point), name. Recommended: mediaMonitored (MediaValue: water, groundwater), measurementRegime, observingCapability. The observed property shall be linked using the observingCapability association. Parameters: pH, dissolved oxygen, turbidity, contaminants.

name: Accessibility
inspire_spec: No direct INSPIRE theme (derived accessibility analysis)
description: Measures of population access to essential services including healthcare, education, employment, and public transport within defined travel times or distances.
requirements: No direct INSPIRE theme; accessibility is derived analytical data combining service locations with transport networks. Required: unique_id, geometry (raster grid or polygon zones), serviceType (healthcare, education, employment, public transport), travelMode (walking, driving, public transit), threshold (time in minutes or distance in km). Recommended: calculationMethod (network analysis, Euclidean), populationServed, temporalReference (peak/off-peak). ISO 37123 indicators: 8.5 (public transport accessibility), 11.5 (healthcare accessibility).

name: Emergency Response and Early Warnings
description: Coverage and capacity of multi-hazard early warning systems including population reached, communication channels, and response protocols.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.12 + ISO 37123:2019 indicator 15.1. Required: unique_id, geometry (coverage area). Recommended: typeOfHazard (hazards covered). ISO 37123 15.1: Percentage of population covered by multi-hazard early warning systems shall be calculated as the population covered by early warning systems divided by total city population multiplied by 100. Include: hazard types, warning channels, lead time.

name: Evacuation Routes
description: Designated pathways for emergency evacuation including roads, assembly points, and shelter locations with capacity and accessibility attributes.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.I.7: Feature type: RoadLink or TransportLinkSequence. Required: unique_id, geometry (line for routes, point for assembly areas/shelters). Recommended: functionalRoadClass, formOfWay. Include: route designation, capacity (persons/hour), hazard type served, shelter locations with capacity, accessibility for mobility-impaired. ISO 37123 indicator 15.3: Percentage of population living within 500m of an identified evacuation route.

name: Access to Drinking Water
inspire_spec: D2.8.III.6 Utility and Governmental Services v3.0
description: Percentage of city population with reliable access to safe drinking water supply, including piped connections and protected sources.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.6 + ISO 37123:2019 indicators 23.1, 23.2. Required: unique_id, utilityNetworkType = water. Recommended: serviceArea, operationalActivityPeriod. ISO 37123 23.1: Number of different sources each providing at least 5% of total water supply. ISO 37123 23.2: Percentage of population with access to potable water supply that can be served by alternative means for 72 hours.

name: Access to Sanitation
inspire_spec: D2.8.III.6 Utility and Governmental Services v3.0
description: Percentage of city population with access to improved sanitation facilities, including sewerage connections and safe on-site systems.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.6: Feature type: UtilityNetwork. Required: unique_id, utilityNetworkType = sewer. SewerPipe attributes: sewerWaterType (SewerWaterTypeValue: combined, sanitary, stormWater). Include: service coverage percentage, treatment level. ISO 37120: Percentage of city population with access to improved sanitation.

name: Cellular Towers
inspire_spec: D2.8.III.6 Utility and Governmental Services v3.0
description: Point locations of telecommunications tower infrastructure including cell sites, antenna arrays, and associated facilities.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.6: Feature type: UtilityNetworkElement. Required: unique_id, geometry (point). Recommended: utilityNetworkType = telecommunications, operationalActivityPeriod. Include: tower height, coverage area, operator, technology type, power backup availability.

name: Drainage Systems
inspire_spec: D2.8.III.6 Utility and Governmental Services v3.0 + D2.8.I.8 Hydrography v3.2
description: Urban stormwater drainage infrastructure including storm drains, culverts, detention basins, and outfalls with capacity and condition attributes.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.6 + D2.8.I.8: Feature type: SewerPipe (stormwater). Required: unique_id, geometry (line for pipes, point for nodes). sewerWaterType = stormWater. A sewer pipe is used to convey sewage (wastewater and stormwater). Include: pipe diameter, capacity, material, condition, outfall locations, flow direction.

name: Precipitation Gauge
description: Rainfall measurement stations providing time series of precipitation amounts for hydrological analysis and flood forecasting.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.14 + ISO 37123:2019 indicator 8.4. ISO 19156 O&M. Required: phenomenonTime, observedProperty = precipitation_amount, featureOfInterest (station point), result (mm). ISO 37123 8.4: Annual frequency of extreme rainfall events shall be calculated as the number of days exceeding the local extreme rainfall threshold. Include: gauge type, temporal resolution.

name: Stream Gauge
description: River flow monitoring stations providing time series of water level and discharge for flood forecasting and water resource management.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.7: Feature type: EnvironmentalMonitoringFacility. Required: unique_id, geometry (point), name. Recommended: mediaMonitored = water, measurementRegime (MeasurementRegimeValue: continuousDataCollection, periodicDataCollection, adHocDataCollection), mobile = false, observingCapability with observedProperty (water level, discharge).

name: Channel Hydrography
description: Detailed survey data of natural and modified stream channels including cross-sections, bed elevation, and hydraulic characteristics.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.I.8: Feature type: Watercourse with detailed attributes. Required: unique_id, geometry (line). Recommended: crossSection attributes, bankSide, waterLevelCategory (WaterLevelValue: highWater, meanHighWater, meanLowWater, lowWater). The water level category defines the water level to which a representation of water extent corresponds.

name: Rivers
description: Hydrographic network of natural watercourses including streams, rivers, and canals with flow direction and watershed attributes.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.I.8: Feature type: Watercourse. Required: unique_id, geometry (line for centreline or polygon for area representation). Recommended: origin (OriginValue: natural, manMade), persistence (HydrologicalPersistenceValue: perennial, intermittent, ephemeral, dry), tidal (Boolean), width (WidthRange), streamOrder (HydroOrderCode using Strahler or Horton method). Network topology: WatercourseLink connecting at HydroNode (source, outlet, junction, boundary).

name: Groundwater
inspire_spec: D2.8.II.4 Geology v3.0 + D2.8.I.8 Hydrography v3.2
description: Subsurface water resources including aquifer locations, depth, recharge rates, and extraction levels relevant to water supply and subsidence risk.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.II.4 (Hydrogeology) + D2.8.I.8: Feature type: Aquifer (via GeologicUnit) or GroundWaterBody. Required: unique_id, geometry (polygon for extent, point for wells). Recommended: aquiferType (AquiferTypeValue: confinedSubArtesian, confinedArtesian, unconfined), permeability, storativity. Include: depth to water table, recharge rate, extraction rate, water quality indicators. Relevant for subsidence hazard assessment in over-extraction areas.

name: Sea Surface Temperature
description: Ocean and coastal water temperature measurements from satellites or monitoring stations for marine and climate analysis.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.III.15: O&M Observation or GridCoverage. Required: phenomenonTime, observedProperty = sea_surface_temperature (CF Standard Name), result (temperature). Parameters shall follow CF Standard Names convention. Include: sensor type (buoy, satellite), spatial coverage, quality flags. NetCDF encoding recommended.

name: Shoreline
description: Coastal boundary delineating the interface between land and water, used for coastal hazard and erosion analysis.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.I.8: Feature type: LandWaterBoundary. Required: unique_id, geometry (line). Recommended: origin (OriginValue), waterLevelCategory (WaterLevelValue). The land-water boundary represents the line where a land mass is in contact with a body of water. Include tidal datum reference.

name: Water Areas
inspire_spec: D2.8.I.8 Hydrography v3.2 + D2.8.II.2 Land Cover v3.0
description: Surface water bodies including lakes, reservoirs, ponds, and wetlands classified as land cover or hydrographic features.
requirements: INSPIRE D2.8.I.8: Feature type: StandingWater. Required: unique_id, geometry (point or polygon). Only points or surfaces are allowed for StandingWater. Recommended: elevation (Measure), meanDepth (Length), surfaceArea (Area), tidal (Boolean), persistence (HydrologicalPersistenceValue). Include wetlands via Land Cover classification.
